Se acepta tarjeta de crédito y hay espacio de parqueo disponible.Soda Tapia, is one of those places, traditional. It has the advantage that it is open 24 x 7 . You can ask for a breakfast at 10pm and they will serve you; As well as the famous sandwich in Spanish bread, "arreglados" , fruit salad and the "granizados". Major credit card accepted and has free parking.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: This used to be an iconic place where people used to go for breakfast or any other time to enjoy their salads and/or their sandwiches. However, the place it's just not what it used to be. The food is good, if you don't mind being served in plastic dinnerware. However, the service is just incredibly slow. It took our waiter, almost 1/2 hour to take our order and almost an hour to get our food! We went there for breakfast but ended having lunch! Though our pinto and eggs was good, it was not worth the wait.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: This was an iconic "fountain soda" with great sandwiches and costa rican light fare. But... the service has dropped from what used to be professional waiters to young inexperienced staff. The great thing about Soda Tapia is that it still offers service. If you are not in the mood to sit in the noisy cafeteria, just park in front and they will serve you at your car, they will bring a tray that fits on the window and you can have your food, privacy and music.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: We enjoyed cassados and local food while in Costa Rica. This soda had large tasty servings. You are on a busy noisy street but the environment is present. Great place for hungry diners. French fries terrific. Ice cream outstanding.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: Right across the street from the National stadium on the sabana, this place is an institution. it has been here forever, I don't know if it ever closes they serve everything from breakfast to dinner and everything in between. it is always crowded and is well worth it. fun cheap eats.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: Went to this place for Lunch since it was recommended by Lonely Planet and the place was very busy. The overall impression is of a place that is not clean. We ordered the Gordo sandwich and the chicken. Chicken was not cooked enough, the black beans were acid, the sandwich was chewy and the meat was inside uneatable. We ended up eating the fries only and spent 30 usd.....

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: I went there after people said "soda tapia" "soda tapia". Only to find out bad service.As they are already popular because it is quite old, they have forgotten how to serve people. Take forever to serve you. Sometimes even forget.Nothing better than the sodas in the middle of nowhere. Everything is normal maybe lower than normal. People go here only because their grandparents used to go here. I would not go again and would rather dine in other soda which is not so popular.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: This is a great place for fast food, tico style. I had the best tamale ever, wrapped in a banana leaf, one is a full meal.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: Traditional food, big coffees, excelent fruit drinks, tasty and cold. Price so and so, can be a little bit cheaper for what they offer, bur they are kind, friendly and show respect.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: The place is not the great in terms of beauty, but the service is great and both the drinks and the desserts are amazing. You need to try the Cas Soda (like guava water), the granizado (a tipical frappe) and Torta Chilena is a MUST. (cake with dulce de leche)

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: This place is on sort of a busy street, but has such a great feel and awesome food/deserts you have to stop here if you can. I got a burger, the wife got the fish, and we both shared a fruit/ice cream bowl and loved every bit of it. Service was great and the area was vibrant and alive. If you like good eats and great deserts make sure you stop here when you're in the area!

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: So this restaurant serves breakfast, lunch and dinner. If I had to pick I would highly recommend a breakfast there. Food is mostly typical food you would find at home in this country. Worth the visit!

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: This was my first meal in Costa Rica, and one of the most delicious. I had the chicken dinner and the chicken was extremely well seasoned! Rice/beans and salad were all great as well. But the star was the Guayabana aguafresca. I have no idea why the States hasn't figured out about guaybana yet - it's a delicious fruit! This is clearly a place favored by locals and tourists alike. With delicious food like that and giant portions for a tiny price tag, it's no wonder this is such a popular place.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: Like an old time diner out of "Happy Days"....out of the 1950's complete with servers wearing the old traditional little hats. You place your order by placing an X on a piece of paper beside the item you want. The menu is expansive and includes the local flat toasted Cuban-like sandwiches, ice creams, and hamburgers including one giant quarter kilo with cheese.....a true monster burger. The prices are no less than those in the U.S.A. so don't expect a super cheap bill. There is both outside dining with chairs near a main street, or inside dining with tables and booths. Easy walking distance to several area hotels.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: good food, confortable place, need put more attention in the service attention, the prices are good.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: We had a late lunch here, after visiting the park and free art museum across the street. I had a tamale and he hand a carne plate. Very nice food and great service. English speaking and menu's. Cute place. I also got 2 scoops of ice cream. They didn't have all of the flavors that were on the menu but he told us which ones they had. Cas is a Costa Rican Fruit that's a bit like Guava and the ice cream was delicious. The strawberry was good too. Hubby's chocolate shake was also very nice. We got out of there for about $25 USD. Amazing!!

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: The meal here was tasty but it was disappointing that the Huevos Rancheros did not come with a Tortilla. The food was traditional Costa Rican, which is why we enjoyed the meal so much.The service was very good. We got our food fast, which is always great if the food tastes good!

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: This place could improve a little bit, but the price is really cheap and the food is nice, traditional Costa rican food tastes awesome, give it a chance

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: Seems to be a traditional place in San Jose, but we were expecting another kind of food. We had steak sandwiches, wich are pretty big (4 portions) and good. Shakes are also BIG.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: It has been many years since I visited this Soda! I loved it then and love it now. The fruit salad was sooo yummy. The sandwich was great and the shakes amazing.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: Here, the places who sell 'casados', breakfast, hamburgers and that sort of food, are called 'sodas'. This is a fancier kind, a bit more expensive than the traditional 'soda', but nicer, cleaner, bigger and the food is really good. Famous for their fruit salads, but their breakfasts are my favorite. Ask for a 'gallo pinto' sided with one (or more) of their great options... delicious!

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: Located on a busy corner in Sabana, the Soda Tapia is a favourite breakfast and lunch for Ticos. It's old and a bit scruffy, but the food is great and the service excellent. Eat typico, and enjoy the colour. After dining, take a walk across the street to the National Gallery, or stroll through the lovely Sabana park.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: I was not impressed with this place whatsoever.  We ordered a hamburger and a sandwich. The hamburger was just not good, and the sandwich was just OK.  I wouldn't recommend this place.  Maybe their other food is better?  I sure hope so.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: Soda Tapia has been catering to guess for many decades and offers simple and greasy food 24 hours a day. It is specially packed with people at late night / early morning when all other restaurants and night clubs have closed.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: We ate here 3 times in 2 days that we stayed in San Jose. Food was great, and there was a lot of it. We got their breakfast plate which was 5200 colones or around $11 USD. The dinner was also very good. Of all things, we really liked the french fries that we got our toddler. What we enjoyed most was that their parking lot was free and convenient. We were not used to San Jose traffic the first few days so having somewhere to conveniently and securely park the car while we went to eat was important and helpful.Even though my husband is a Spanish speaker, they could tell that I wasn't able to respond and someone came over to give me a translated menu which was helpful. Generally, at least 1 or 2 people, spoke English well, or well enough to answer our food questions or ring us up.Would definitely recommend, especially on your first day in the city until you get your barrings.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: We have seen a lot of soda's in Costa Rica, but this one was more a Costa Rican McDonald's. I can't remember if there were any Costa Rican dishes on the menu (at least...that is what we expected a soda to serve). We had a salad and a burger and it was nothing special (way too less salad and too much ham and cheese).

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: Soda Tapia reminds me more of an American style diner than the classic sodas of the Central Market but it's the perfect place for a fruit drink and (in my opinion) some of the best gallo pinto in the country while watching pass the madness that is San Jose traffic. Service is efficient and prompt. Parking assistance is offered. No alcohol.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: I grew up eating at the Soda Tapia, so when I came for a visit after a few years abroad, I had to go and get my granizado. The quality of the food was very bad, my daughter ordered a cheese sandwich that was horrible. The drink (mora en agua) didn't taste fresh. Someone in my table complained about their sandwich. My kids ordered chocolate ice cream that was disgusting (yes , ice cream and disgusting, difficult to achieve). But the top of my bad experience was the fact that their ice shaving machine broke so they were not serving the granizado I was dreaming of. Not coming back.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: Popular with locals. Good menu and reasonable prices. Easy location to find and walk from there. Service is good, but be prepared to order when they come to your table.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: A chain of Fast food Sodas " many around San Jose . Food is served on paper plates and you order by checking off on a list of food available what you want . Cheap eats but not very good .all of them are on busy streets so you inhale exhaust as you eat . Wait staff is typically harried and a bit surly.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: I went here for a late dinner after a long day and was happy that the menu was fairly cheap. The menu had burgers, sandwiches, and some meat dishes with rice and beans. I went with the fish with rice/beans and my meal was quite large and filling. They also had a nice variety of natural juices, with pineapple being very GOOD! This restaurant is more like a diner-style place, nothing fancy at all. It is not centrally located but if you're near the area it is worth checking out for fast and cheap eats.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: The place itself is old..have a great and fast service. The food is too greasy, regular prices. Bathrooms are not clean and they have no soap. No wifi available.I'm sure this place could be way better! Not even close what it used to be!

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: The restaurant is not great, but its tradition makes it a definite stop for anyone visiting SJO. Get yourself a Lorenzo Sandwich. You are welcome.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: We had a late lunch/early dinner after arriving in San José. It was just a short walk from our hotel (Autentico) as well as being right across the street from La Sabana Park. The front desk at the hotel had recommended this place as quick and having good food. They were right on both accounts. The service was very good and they menus in English, and the server was able to answer any questions we had. We got our food quickly, which was appreciated as we were hungry after our flight to Costa Rica. We both got a steak sandwich and they were huge! In hindsight, we should have just got one to split. We also had some of the local juices to drink and they were great. The restaurant has some indoor seating, but we chose to eat out on the covered patio. They also serve customers in the cars. Overall, it was a good place to eat and I'd eat here again next time we're in San José.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: Stopped in for a quick dinner having enjoyed eating here on prior visits to CR. Found everything the same except the food! I was very disappointed with my gallo pinto. The rice was crunchy and the beans undercooked. I ordered it with eggs which I assumed would be scrambled and mixed into the rice and beans only to find two fried, greasy sunny side up eggs staring up at me. Service was pleasant and quick. Maybe it was a busy day and they rushed the preparation. I will still try it again and order a sandwich and the famous fruit dishes.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: We shared the grilled Lorenzo sandwich and had a tough time finishing it. It wa very good and hit the spot after a busy day walking around San Jose. The staff are friendly and the service was very good. Unfortunately, we didn't have room for the great looking ice cream. Maybe on the next visit...

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: Its a really nice place, have lots of costarican food, its very fast, opens very late, very good price. It can be say that is a nice dinner

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: Those of us who are old enough can remember when this was a drive in, sit in your car and be served restaurant.  that died many years ago, but the menu is the same.  Fast Costarican food, sandwiches and drinks and ice cream.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: Good breakfast food, tons of options, very affordable and attentive staff. You order off a sheet so makes it easy to submit your order. English menu.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: Simple and casual has outdoors and some indoor seating. Has a kind of a Ruby's look. Has a wide selection of sandwiches, fruit drinks and great coffee. It tends to get really busy later at night so it might take a awhile for you to get your order. The staff is very friendly.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: Outdoor, very pleasant local restaurant. Wide selection of sandwiches, fruit and ice cream drinks, desserts, and much more.  Excellent service, very reasonable prices, and typical of Costa Rican restaurants, gratuity is included in the check.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: If you don't feel like going to a restaurant...try Soda Tapia...affordable, FRESH juices, food good and you get enough for what you pay.Very popular and open 24 hrs...

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: Mediocre overpriced food and slow service. I was especially happy for the double chargeFor your own piece of mind use cash and not credit card

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: Sandwiches are huge! I wish the waiter told us we can split one between the two of us. Great french fries too! Biggest problem was that it took 40 minutes for the food to come out and we had to take it to go because our ride was waiting for us.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: Incredible traditional place in CR , all meals and all times 24/7 and the menu variety is just amazing and tasty! I so recommend the freak fast tapia the whole TICA experience !

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: This place was definitely hopping when we went here around 2pm on a Tuesday. The sandwiches were really big. I was not crazy about the one we got because it had refried beans on it. The french fries were very good.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: I've been several times for lunch or breakfast or just a mid afternoon snack. It's one of my favorite places to wait out a thunderstorm, watch the traffic and near misses. The food is very basic: burgers, pinto, etc. the breakfast pinto con huevos y tocineta (bacon and eggs) is very good. My companion had a burger which looked good and got good reviews from her. After a meal a walk through Sabana Park makes for a pleasant experience.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: A friend of a friend recommended the hamburgers, so we wanted to try it. It's across the street from Saranac Park 1 block off Central Avenue. We both ordered the Tapia Burger. It came without the lettuce and refried beans that were in the menu description. The patty was like the bulk pressed and formed patties and there was only a tiny smear off their social dressing. Like I said, the fries were good.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: This is a very nice place. Food is real good but portions are huge. Ice cream & shakes are delicious. It is a little bit pricy ( well Costa Rica is pricy ). Remember that the Exchange rate is close to 525 colones for US$ 1.00 .

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: Very good place. Guy Fieri's gotta check this place out. We made the mistake of ordering three things to share, an 'arreglado' or little sandwich, gallo pinto or a giant plate of rice and beans, two eggs, ham and bread and 'el gordo' a giant foot-long steak and ham sandwich. We were about to explode when we left and still had leftover. Their guanabana milkshake was amazing!

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: An Ice Cream salad? You'd ask. That's right I say.. you must try it. Soda Tapia is a Costa Rican landmark. It has been in business for over 50 years and still stands as one of the most delicious places to eat, affordably that is, if you're on a budget. But if you're visiting with family or friends of the love of your life you can't leave Costa Rica before sitting down at one of the tree locations in San Jose. Ask for a "Ensalada de Frutas" and add your choice of over 5 delicious ice cream flavors. Enjoy!

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: Nice little restaurant by the side of a busy street in San Jose.  We ordered a couple of sandwiches and were pleasantly surprised.  Cost was low and value for the money was very good.  Had English menus.  Coffee was solid.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: Cool diner feel. Awesome atmosphere, great food, delicious shakes.  Service was great, we sat outside.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: The best lápices (costarican sandwiches) and fruit ice cream in town. This place has been in Costa Rica forever, it is one of the oldest in town, owned by the same familia Tapia. They also have to go orders.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: This place has huge hamburgers! If you are an American that is jonesing for some food from home, this is a good place to go if you decide to not go to the McDonalds a block away. Giant hamburgers hat are pretty good and delicious French fries and milkshakes. I'd do 4.5 if it would let me.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: Over the past 15 years i have eaten in Soda Tapia about 3 times.  Usually not by my choice.  there are better places to eat in San Jose.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: We ordered takeout as the restaurant was only a 5 minute walk away. There is lots of seating, mainly outdoors facing the busy street with lots of traffic. Not much ambiance.We ordered the beef tacos (which were more like fried Tex-Mex style flautus with dried shredded beef) along with the steak with onions that came with rice and beans and french fries. The steak was unusually soft but tasty, did not care for the tacos. It was okay but not worth going back to.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: As excited as I was to try this restaurant, I was sadly disappointed. It is similar to a Steak and Shake style eatery and the qualify of the food was subpar. Not sure if they were having an off night or what but my friends and I were not thrilled. We had a burger (tasted like a frozen patty) and a steak sandwich (could not even bite into it it was so tough).

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: If you're in the mood for a burger & fries, this is the place. Grab a table outside to watch the world drive by. The waiter will drop off a list of items (Spanish only): check off the ones you want. I had a chicken burger with fries and a watermelon batido. It was what I needed at the time.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: Oscar was super helpful, and the typical Costa Rican dishes were MUY BIEN, very good. We wiil go back while here in San Jose.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: Ok, so I have already reviewed the Soda Tapia and gave a good review. But that Was in San Jose.This time I took my family (2 adults/3 children) to the Santa Ana - Lindora location. Don't bother. The location is good, the food is mostly deep fried diner style for lunch/dinner. The Staff is rude and ignorant.There is clearly no management of staff by any standards. Whoever is in charge is clearly not doing there job.The wait staff spent the whole time watching the big TV pointed right at the work area. But THE worst part was that we proceeded to watch them make rude comments about every customer that came into the restraunt. With all the customers watching and they did not care.This review is in regards to the cashier and the waiter/and waitress. We where there on Feb 24 2015 at 7 pm, We are not commenting on the cooks as they looked like they were working hard.Go elsewhere

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: I had lunch at the Soda Tapia opposite Sabana Park and was pleased with the sandwich and fruit milkshake so I decided to try the original Soda Tapia in the Mercado Central which has been there for 120 years! Their gallo pinto was the best I have had in Costa Rica, flavorful and moist, probably made with chicken broth as well as onions, garlic, peppers, chili, Costa Rica’s equivalent of Worcestershire sauce and who knows what other flavorings, served with bread and fried plantains. Costing 1900 colones/$3.50, I added fried cheese (600 colones/$1.15) and drank a fruit and milk batido (1500 colones/$3). Of course they serve the national dish of casado, sandwiches and soups. But you can order breakfast all day long which is why I had the gallo pinto. I will certainly go back to the Central Market Soda Tapia branch for more.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: Filled with locals and the food was fine.  Waiters are nice and work hard...must walk 10 miles a day.  We had hamburger and tacos.  It was OK but a bit more expensive than we had expected.  Desserts looked awesome!

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: My other half is a born and raised Costa Rican and he brings me here every time we are in San Jose. This place has a wonderfully familiar vibe and is always packed. The food is delicious, portions generous and service very nice (though sometimes a bit slow). We love this place so much, we even brought 50 of our wedding guests for dinner before the wedding day and everyone liked the food. The manager who took care of us was beyond nice and served such a large group very efficiently. We'll be going back there again and again.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: This restaurant was recommended by a seasoned Costa Rican traveler.  We ordered the Costa Rican dishes and liked them all.   the topper on the meal was the ice cream "salad" which was also recommended.   Great homemade fruit infused ice cream.   Great local restaurant

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: You can eat very fresh tropical fruits and delicious ice cream.  Also they have very good coffee (maybe the best in town).  They also offer lunch and breakfast, everything typical simple Costa Rican food.  I enjoyed it very much. It is open and fresh.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: Always came here and it's awesome the food but today it was all backwards. They took too long to bring us the order. And it disappointed me for the 1st time. The chicken rice wasn't chicken rice and the order was incomplete.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: So...we were looking for a quick bite to eat in San Jose and decided on Soda Tapia based on the fact that it is always crowded. We tried the "El gordo," atun, the hamburger and another sandwich. The fries were good, American style fries. :) The hamburger was HUGE. Big enough for two people. However the hamburger was very dry. Very dry. The atun (tuna) was not so great. El gordo was the best of the lot. Huge portions. Cheap prices. OK food for a quick stop.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: This is a fast food restaurant, the menu is not big and it has barely change in several years. I have to say that there re a couple of options in the menu that I really like (the "gordo" chicken sandwich, the "arreglados") but the rest is almost the same as if you go to a regular soda. They try to give the impression to be a dinner, but with a 3 fork restaurant prices.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: if u are in the middle of paseo colon and want to have a good meal or just a cup of ice cream ,or maybe some coffe with a sandwich this is the place to go , and the best thing is that u can go at any time of the day.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: Is a great place to have a great meal at anytime of the day. I went with my friends and family, is always delicious. The only thing that I would change is that the Soda Tapia that is in Lindora be the same cowsy place as the original one that is in SJ downtown. The price is ok for the type of food served.Excellent place to enjoy a meal.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: I live relatively near to Soda Tapia on La Sabana; consequently I was a frequent customer in the past. This is a late hour, sit-down, non alcoholic local restaurant. I no longer visit this chain because it has gone from bad to worse. You’ll often see the place crowded on weekends, well, that’s because people who visit the nearby park find this as the only informal restaurant in the area. There is so much that needs to be worked on that I find it hard to believe they have a Manager. As soon as you get there, you realize the few waiters they have on site and any given time are overworked. This alone causes them to take longer to wait on new tables or bring receipts. The food is local and is certainly OVER PRICED, I am beleaguered at the prices for simple sandwiches and molten fruit drinks. Taste and preparation has gone from bad to worse. Take outs are often times shortened, i.e, sometimes the ham is missing or plantains or bread wasn’t included. I love stewed beans and rice but taste is unpredictable. Their restroom needs to be entirely redone. The lady at the cashier whose name is Maria (if my memory is on tact) has no customer service skills whatsoever. She is very sloppy and looks like she could care less about being there. She doesn’t greet you or say thanks or ask how the meal was or apologize for the long wait….pretty much charging and giving change like a robot. They aside from retraining for proper customer delight and consistency in food preparation; need to: 1) get more waiters, 2) have the customers go to the cashier and pay on their own or 3) hire another cashier. Very poor Costa Rican service and food and people keep complaining but going back.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: Overall, Soda Tapia is like a glorified SODA, (local eatery) you shouldn't expect much when you go there. Try to stay away from Steak sandwich, mine came out of the sandwich with the first bite, was absolutely hard to bite off and had to cut it with knife. Service is relatively OK. They come to you quickly and never come back to check on you unless you call them. In all fairness, they do look around to see if anybody is calling though. Try to stay with mainstream type of food. Soft by nature, like chicken. Their Gallo Pinto (special rice and beans for breakfast) is nothing to write home about. Prices are acceptable.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: The arreglados are terrific, and so are the casados! A bit noise but it's great for people watching.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: If you are looking for a traditional Costa Rican style "soda", do yourself a favor and go to one of the million small hole in the wall places that you can find almost anywhere instead of Soda Tapia. This is a chain version and, in my opinion, the food tends to be prepared with less care, and the prices are higher than you would pay in a normal soda. It just isn't worth the visit. If you want Costa Rican traditional then go for it -- Soda Tapia is not a good representation of the genre. Or if you want a diner or American style food, then find that type of restaurant and don't bother with Soda Tapia.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: We thought we were going to an old, local tapia, but we were met with the Costa Rican interpretation of a classical 50s American diner. It was naturally shakes n burgers, but it was a funny experience. And where else would you find frijoles in almost all dishes and burgers? Go there once to feel the ambiance, but that is it..

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: We have been to the Soda Tapia several times before and found it to be okay , not great just ok . This time the food was well not what most would cal okay. The orders had become smaller, the chicken I had was over cooked and the fires cold. My wifes order was equally poor. The server did not care and said nothing when asked if he could do something. It was not busy and not the normal amount of people there. SO maybe that is why.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: We saw the reviews and while in San Jose decided to try this place out. There were long lines with locals so we thought this was going to be great. It was not. The place is not clean. Bathrooms are horrid. Food was mostly sandwiches, french fries, chicken nuggets etc. Not at all what I expected. Quality of food was just mediocre. Nothing great at all. Worst part was the waiter. 2 adults entrees and 2 kid entrees and 4 drinks. Total bill was $45. My husband is fluent in Spanish. So he asked the waiter if the tip was included in the bill. The bill showed 2 different taxes but did not say "tip." It just said "tax" 2 times. Waiter told us that the tip was NOT included. We asked again to double check. So we tipped him 15% and later found out that in Costa Rica ALL restaurants by law charged a 10% service tax on the bill.So the waiter knowingly dupped us. Dishonest! I would never go back.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: Took a vacation to Costa Rica which was my first time and as soon as i left the airport family took me here! i loved everything about it, the space where they are located to the food. I ordered Gallo Pinto with carne encebollada which comes with eggs & platanos! and i probably came here 4 days out 7 that i was in town! cant wait to go back !

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: For someone who gee up in Costa Rica, I go here to eat the things I miss, casado, arreglados, copos, horchata, helado con fruta!

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: I remember Soda Tapia from early childhood. It is always full of people, clients keep coming back time and time again.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: If you want a sandwich or something light, you can try this place, but do not expect much. Service is not the best and quality of the food either. Perhaps Gallo Pinto, typical Costa Rican food for breakfast, is the best dish they have.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: Go to the ST at Sabana Park. Meet Ticos here or just watch the crowd. Dare you to have a conversation with the highway traffic at your feet.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: We stopped here late for a snack and battidos. The food was good, service was quick and they are open 24 hours a day!

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: I have only been to the one at the end of Paseo Colon near La Sabana. I go here for breakfast when it's not included with my hotel.Good food, reasonable service; decent prices for what you get.I saw one near Forum in Santa Ana and want to try it

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: I visited their Lindora location for lunch and I was very surprised with the good food, simple but good, I had a Chicken Pocket with a lot of cheese and I mean a lot of cheese. The atmosphere reminds me to a good old diner back in Uptown Minneapolis.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: We really enjoyed breakfast here! We tried a late breakfast and we all loved the food. Nothing fancy but a very traditional place to eat. Good service as well.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: We visited their Santa Ana location for a late lunch/early dinner since we were not sure of our evening plans. Our server was very friendly and prompt. We ordered 'El Gordo,' which was a HUGE hit with half the sandwich left over for later, and 'El Lorrenzo,' which was their 'most popular/traditional' sandwich (also with half left over, but couldn't compare to El Gordo), as well as a side of fries. It was about $20 and we left oh-so-full. It seems more like a chain restaurant. Perhaps a Costa Rican 'Big Boy.'

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: During my trip to San Jose I took a breakfast in both location The one downtown in ok The one in Lindora Santa Ana did not Have bacon at 10am They gave me some ham not very tasty and try to charge me for another Serving of bacon and eggsClean ok food fast service

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: Very busy roadside location but local fast food experience with quick service and close to the hotel and park.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: It is not a 5 star restaurant but The chicken casado is pretty goodAnd fresh service is fast is you speak Spanish it is faster Good meal value

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: This soda was recommended to us by our driver. He told us it was typical Costa Rican food that was cheap but very good. We found it to be quite expensive for lunch and my food was terrible. I ordered tacos and got two very small sort of rolled taco looking tacos. The meat was too tough to even bite. My husband ordered the hamburger…beware Americans…this is not like an American hamburger. It was huge but tasted funny. My daughter ordered a chicken sandwich with was also huge but very tasty. My son ordered something else that was just ok.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: Good location for my walk about but only just average on food.  I also thought the prices were too high.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: We came in to check it out, I think it was complicated to order the first time and hard to read/understand their menus.  The food was good but the shakes were our favorite.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: Ok so to level set, this is essentially diner food, costa rican style. So if you keep that in mind it should level set your expectations :) I had a typical grilled chicken casado and it was pretty dicey. I would definitely not order it again. But the hamburgers are supposedly really good so I'll try that next time.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: We got caught in the rain while we were in the park across the street and decided to take safe harbor in the soda. We enjoyed sitting under the awning at the front of the restaurant, looking out at the people on the street while eating our dinner.The waiter was great and helped us to understand the menu with our extremely limited Spanish. We ordered a couple of local dishes. One was chicken and the other beef. They came with the standard rice & beans and salad with great salsa. I think my wife's dish had a vegetable and mine had some very good caramelized plantains. We also had a couple of diet cokes and I think the whole thing came to about $9 or $10.It's not gourmet dining, but you wouldn't expect that at a soda. We had a fun time spending a break from the rain at this 50's style diner. The price was great and the food was very good. We would recommend stopping here if you are on this end of town.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: We wanted authentic food where the Ticos eat, so we came to Soda Tapia. We ordered two popular dishes, a hamburger (surprise!) and the "pechuga de pollo." The hamburger was downright GROSS. We shared the chicken dish, and it was OK, but not what we expected.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: The first thing I do when I visit a country is to try the typical cousine. So in Costa Rica there is a place you must visit Soda Tapia. This place is part of the Costarrican culture. They prepare delicious costarican sanwhiches (ask for the sandwish Lapiz simply perfect). They also offers pastry, coffee, the typical casado (rice and beans, salad, stew and accompained with some meal.Soda Tapia stablished 80 years ago or maybe more so ask some tico and they will give you the adress. The prices are very good and the service is really good.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: If you just want to try tipico food, there are a lot better places to go. We hadn't been the for 20 years because of our first horrible experience. We were in the area of their relatively new place in Pozos And since our regular restaurant was still closed we decided to try it. If anything it was worse than the old one. It is absolutely filthy and the service was horrible. It took us 25 minutes to get two orders of dry toast (we asked for buttered) and two cups of the worst coffee that I have ever had in CR. It tasted like they hadn't cleaned out the urn since the day they opened. It will be another 20 years before I go there again. Maybe by then I will be too senile to remember how bad it was.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: We were in a hurry, but they messed up my eggs TWICE, food was TOO GREASY, the locations of several restaurants are traffic noisy,  the waitress was just "ok".

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: Soda Tapia is the name of a chain of restaurants in San Jose, Costa Rica. The one on Calle 42 (aka PanAmerican highway) near Parque Sabana and Paseo Colon is a real find. Open 24/7 it serves typical Costa Rica fare, including delicious arreglado. Think hamburger bun made of croissant-like pastry and sandwiching all sorts of great fillings. They have half a dozen varieties. Their arroz con pollo plate is perfection. Fruit smoothies come made ‘con leche’ or ‘con agua’. Try them made with cas . It’s like guava, and delicious. A cas smoothie and arroz con pollo plate will set you back less than $10. The English menu is less extensive than the Spanish one. Get the Spanish one and work your way through it. It will be a list of what they offer; check off what you want and how many. Then sit back, watch the traffic go by and get your taste buds ready.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: food was fine, prices were much higher than the location (poor, on a busy intersection) and the food quality and quantity justifies

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: I decided to visit Sodia Tapia again after my previous disappointing experience (http://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowUserReviews-g309293-d780163-r153193871-Soda_Tapia-San_Jose_San_Jose_Metro_Province_of_San_Jose.html#REVIEWS) because I was in need of a cup of coffee and couldn´t find anywhere else nearby. I terribly regret my decision. This is, without a doubt, one of the worst dining establishments I have been to in Costa Rica, and I live here. Here were the problems with my second visit:SERVICE: I ordered a simple cup of café con leche (coffee with milk) to go. This "order" took more than 5 minutes to prepare despite the fact that all the waitstaff was standing behind the counter doing absolutely nothing or taking care of non-urgent tasks like restocking supplies. All the while I stood there directly in front of them (the only customer waiting for anything), and they did not even acknowledge my presence.FOOD: The coffee with milk was horrible. It was literally worse than instant coffee. I saw the way it was prepared and the woman making it literally put in 75% milk and 25% coffee. It tasted just like that, too--completely washed out and barely any coffee taste whatsoever. VALUE: Again, I have to say that the value was poor. This simple and horrible-tasting cup of coffee with milk ran me almost $2, which doesn´t sound like a lot but definitely is by Costa Rica "soda" standards.The moral of this story is don´t give places like Soda Tapia a second chance. It´s rare that I review the same place two times--only in cases when I´m exceptionally pleased or exceptionally angry. This is definitely the latter. Avoid Soda Tapia at all cost.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: This place does not quite live up to the accolades it has received in various publications. I chose to eat here because it is within walking distance of my hotel north of Parque Sabana. The meals are not cheap - as you would expect from a "soda" restaurant - but are typical Costa Rica fare. I had a "plato del dia" (daily special) with a local beer and it cost me about $7. The service is excellent and lunch is quickly served.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: We ate here two times due to the simplicity and the fact that we were there during Holy Week and some places were closed. The food is great and you can have lots of options to please everyone in the family or couple. The milkshakes are the bomb and you should definitely try one! This place is not expensive, but big enough that you don't have to wait. The waiters are friendly and it's simple to order if you're not a Spanish speaker because you just check a box on an order sheet and they take it. Great service and right near Parque La Sabana!

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: Muy Tico, and the people watching is superb. An entertainment inits self, the food is wonderfully prepared and consistantly good.This is a great value. DO not miss this one.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: Overall, Soda Tapia is one of those places that rests on its laurels and its recommendations in books like Frommer´s and Fodor´s and does not try to improve itself. Not only that, but it seems it has raised its prices as a result. If you come to Soda Tapia, what you are going to get is average food and average service for ABOVE average prices. Not the end of the world, but I would avoid it if you can!SERVICE: Average. Although the food came out very quickly, it took more than 15 minutes and multiple requests from our waiter to get a simple glass of water. The waiters are not interested in helping the people, and it is often hard to even get their attention at all.FOOD: The food is average in quality for San José. The one nice thing I will say is that the menu is quite varied so you can get a typical casado, a burger, or a breakfast all at the same place. I hear their shakes are also supposed to be quite good. VALUE: Poor. A casado here will cost you approximately $8-$10 compared to $4-$5 elsewhere in the city. The one exception is if you come on Fridays, when they have a special on the casados apparently. I think that ATMOSPHERE: Soda Tapia is located near Parque la Sabana, which is certainly nice. But the problem is that it´s at a very busy intersection so if you opt to sit outside, you won´t see much of the park but rather lots of noisy cars, trucks, and buses passing by and disturbing your meal. When we were there, there were also loud and raucous groups of other diners nearby so that is always the risk at a place that has big open eating areas (like Soda Tapia) rather than individual rooms.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: Compared to most other eateries we tried in San Jose this is quite good. The food is tasty...and we found the service to be very good...MUCH better than others. We ate there three or four times and always took an outside table. The prices are reasonable...and the desserts are great.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: I often stop at the Soda Tapia near Parque la Sabana after doing some banking and other business nearby. I Usually have a Tapia burger or an arreglado and cafe con leche. I have also tried their milkshakes. FYI - "Soda" is used in Costa Rica to mean a small restaurant. It has nothing to do with soda as in soda fountain. Most sodas are smaller operations, run by one or two people and serve traditional dishes such as pinto (rice and beans), casados (a big plate of meat, rice, beans and whatever), etc.I like the outdoor seating, but it can sometimes be loud if people are messing with their car alarms (parking is right in front, near the tables). The service is generally quick and pleasant. It's a good place to have a coffee and a bite while you read the paper. I have yet to try any of the larger dishes, but they always look good as they go by.It is a short walk from the offices of the foreign resident association at Casa Canadá. There are big branches of Banco Nacional and Banco de Costa Rica nearby.Some of my Costa Rican friends denigrate the place as being a pricey commercialization of the traditional soda. Prices are a little upscale, but then so is that neighborhood.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: OK for a quick, cheap bite, but don't expect too much. You can get a beer to wash down the tasteless sandwiches. The ice cream isn't very good for a soda fountain place.The locals love it, and the location across from the park is convenient, if a bit noisy.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: The place looks like it belongs in a 70's movie, has a good atmosphere. The food tastes funny, but I am not sure if its Costa Rican culture. A lot of stuff on the menu. Milkshakes are awesome here.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: The restaurant is simple and the food is not bad, but for the price we would expect something tastier and more elaborated. Waiters are not attentive and needed to be called numerous times. However, the restaurant seems to be successful among the local people.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: Food here is a little more expensive than most places in San Jose. But I still love this place. I order from here all the time. Their ice cream is amazing and their service is pretty fast.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: Soda Tapia has consistent food, not great, but not bad either.  The service is always slow, and uninterested in serving their clients

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: We ate at the Lindora location of Soda Tapia on our first and last nights in Costa Rica. We were staying up the street at the Aloft and the restaurant was recommended by the hotel staff. The pollo plate was quite good at 4,000 colones. It came with a large piece of barbecued chicken, beans, rice and french fries. I didn't go to Costa Rica to eat at Applebees, KFC or Taco Bell (all right up the street), so was happy to find Soda Tapia.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: OK it's not haute cuisine, but it's still a good place for a quick bite to eat. I was quite happy with my bean sandwich ($4) and lemonade ($2). Places like this are surprisingly rare in San Jose, which is lamentably overrun with global chains. In fact, the only other cheap eateries on the perimeter of the Parque La Sabana are places like Burger King and Subway. I would much rather eat at Soda Tapia.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: The food was ok, more expensive than meals I've had that were of superior quantity and quality. Its open late hours however and very close to San Jose's largest park.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: Came from the office for day to day lunch; asked for a "gallo de carne" which is a plate with meat; rice and beans and a natural softdrink and charged USD 10.00 for it! Flavor was not great and will never come again.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: Soda Tapia, all arround Costa Rica, is a traditional 7x24 open place to meet your friends.You will find drinks all day, but, they need to improve the burgers, sorry friends!!

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: We ate here for lunch at 12:30pm on a Tuesday. The place was pretty busy, but the servers were very nice. They got us menus in English. We really liked the chicken nuggets and fries (hand-cut and breaded chicken tenders), and the hamburger. The ham and cheese sandwich was just ham and cheese and nothing special. The chocolate milkshake was fine. We chose this place because it is right across the street from the Costa Rican Art Museum in Parque Sabana. Yes, it was noisy sitting outside right next to the Pan American Highway, but we could still have a conversation.Two people next to us had huge bowls of what looked like fruit and sorbet for lunch!

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: You want a cheap meal served quick then this is your place. Staff is always nice. If you are in the Escazu or Santa Ana area go to the one on Lindora Ave.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: Looking for something local.  Really kind staff, although our waitress spoke no English she worked with us on our broken Spanish.  The portions are good, the staff is very friendly and the place is clean.  No fast food meals here - local and fresh.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: local food is very good here and it's open all day and all night. Perfect to go and have a bite at night.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: Excellent to take a costarican breakfast in a traditional place in San Jose for  generations.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: this place has been here forever. literally. the food has always been the same. it's edible and tasty enough, and it's not expensive at all. go for the milkshakes. the grilled cheese sandwiches are nice. the coffee is nothing special.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: This place has its history.... for more than 30 years has pleased people's taste for the local food.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: You need to go to a Soda Tapia if you want to try the local taste. It is a caffe with a variety of dishes, everything has salsa Lizano, a very local sauce that costa ricans just love.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: Fast, clean & modern breakfast/lunch.  Their huevos rancheros is awesome.  Also their signature strawberry jam with clove.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: this place is right next to the Sabana Park, you can sit outside, downside is that the 4 lane street is right in front so its quite noisy.To order it is easy even if you come with a group of people, you get the menue and just check/circle wath you wish then give the waiter the menue back....famos place been here for ever...

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: It is the same food and beverages since I was a teenager, good but not fancy.  People love it though

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: A local's place, it is noisy, with cars driving nearby, and the setting is not the best. And most important, you need to know what to order. They've been known for their "arreglados" (sort of a sandwich) for decades, same with their lapiz (a sandwich). And if you are in Costa Rica, you need to try the "cas" ice cream -- few countries have "cas" (a fruit) -- and a "cas" juice (drink). Tapia has both. Don't expect a fancy place, its where the locals eat.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: I am only basing this on one meal, so take that into consideration.The taco I had was made with shredded beef, typical for here, but it was stringy and tough. I could not eat it in the taco shell, but had to pull it apart and eat it on top of the cabbage salad that was served with it. Service was good.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: It's good to have a food option all night long.. fast service.. good food..

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: They have fast service and everything is good a perfect choice 24 hours a day!!!!

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: Not fancy but good food - excellent meeting place - good location and good service.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: Have stopped there a few times to wait to meet people. Ticos are notoriously late for appointments. So it's a good diea to meet at a simple restaurant. The food is fair, although a bit greasy and overpriced, I think, for what it is it' quite good. This is better than what in the Sattes you would call a "greasy spoon," but many would feel McDonald's is better. Service is friendly but there is no menu. They give you a list and a pencil to mark off your choices. If you don't get it there is sure to be a Gringo at another table who will help you Most of it is a sidewalk cafe although I believe there are a few inside tables. I never looked for one because it's easier to meet the person if you are outside.

Tipo_Comida: Latina, Fuente de soda, Centroamericana, Costarricense
Direccion: Calle 42, Avenidas 2 y 4 Costado este del Parque La Sabana, San José Costa Rica
Comentario: We have eaten there numerous times - and my husband has eaten there many times on previous trips. It is a wonderful place to sit and watch the street traffic, and enjoy a milkshake, a hamburger, or just wonderful toast and fruit. We ate there late at night and were always served in a prompt and friendly manner. They have English/Spanish menus for those who need a little help.
